sentences.en: He presents his own highbrow literary programme.
sentences.cn: 他介绍了自己那个专业性很强的文学项目的情况。

sentences.en: However to major medium and small businesses character, establishing professional team is highbrow apparently.
sentences.cn: 然而对于大部分中小企业而言, 组建专业人员队伍显然是不切实际的.

sentences.en: Many of your readers, including so - called highbrow critics, have repeatedly subjected your books to negative readings.
sentences.cn: 你的很多读者, 包括 所谓 的不切实际的批评家, 不只一次的把你的作品归到消极读物一类.

sentences.en: Not everyone can enjoy highbrow art and literature.
sentences.cn: 阳春白雪不是谁都能欣赏的.

sentences.en: On the other hand , as a intellectual, he uses sapiential discourse to represent highbrow character.
sentences.cn: 另一方面, 何顿用充满哲思的智性言说展示了他作为知识分子应有的品格.

sentences.en: The guest speaker was a highbrow Professor from the local college.
sentences.cn: 那位邀请来的讲演者,是当地大学里一位(自以为)学识渊博的教授.

sentences.en: They try every mean to wrap them in the mantle of lofty thoughts and highbrow pursuits.
sentences.cn: 他们千方百计意味着结束他们的外衣崇高思想和知识分子的追求.

sentences.en: Tones are continuously changing from the highbrow to the common.
sentences.cn: 语调不停变化,有时是阳春白雪,有时是下里巴人.

sentences.en: We had a highbrow discussion on classical music.
sentences.cn: 我们就古典音乐来了一次高水平的讨论.

words.tran_cn: 不切实际的；自炫博学的；知识分子的
卖弄知识的人；知识分子

trans.tran_cn: 文化修养高的，高雅的，学术性的
<美口>（自以为）有高度文化修养的人, 知识分子, 卖弄知识的人
